fgeo.tool 0.0.0.9004
  • Reference
  • fgeo

Read ForestGEO censuses.

Source: R/censuses.R
read_censuses.Rd

This function reads any number of ForestGEO censuses stored in .rdata files and stores them in a nested dataframe of class 'censuses_df', which has a convenient print method and enables using specific methods for working with ForestGEO data.

read_censuses(path_dir, .match = NULL, .id = "censuses")

Arguments

path_dir

String; the path to a directory containing the files to read (all must be of appropriate format; see examples).
.match

If not NULL a string to match specific .rdata file-names (excluding the extension).
.id

If not NULL a variable with this name will be created to inform the source file.

Value

An object of class 'censuses_df'.

See also

rdata_df(), as_censuses().

Other functions to import ForestGEO data: read_fgeo

Examples

library(dplyr)

censuses <- read_censuses(tool_example("rdata"))
class(censuses)
#> [1] "censuses_df" "tbl_df"      "tbl"         "data.frame"

  pick(dbh > 600) %>%
  pull(data)
